KPIs.title: Proposal Clearance
KPIs.description: For the governance process to function properly, all proposals must be processed effectively, and in a reasonable time frame to avoiding blocking new proposals coming in.
successEvents: At no point will the number of active proposal stay at 5 for longer than 14,400 blocks (~24h).
No malicious or unreasonable proposals are approved.
KPIs.annihilation: Unlike other 'annihilations', failure for this KPI will result in the loss of ALL KPI rewards, and a new Council Election will be started immediately.

KPIs.title: Council Reporting
KPIs.description: There needs to be some level of accountability and transparency for the Council. For each Term the Council must produce a report of 'events' and 'Tokenomics' to allow users to make informed votes. This must be submitted as a PR to the Community Repo.
successEvents: The fifth Council on Alexandria (#1065601-#1267201) produces a report based on the 'Council Reporting Template' and the 'Tokenomics' script
KPIs.annihilation: Unlike other 'annihilations', failure for this KPI will result in the loss of ALL KPI rewards.

KPIs.title: Appoint New Council Secretary
KPIs.description: The Council must appoint one of their own as the Council Secretary, responsible for adding Council Reports and representing the Council in the Community Repo (with some enhanced repository maintenance privileges).
successEvents: The Council informally appoints a Council Secretary through a spending proposal and pays them an appropriate rate for their responsibilities.
The spending proposal must provide a link to the Council Secretary's GitHub account so we can provide them 'triage' permissions on the community repo.

KPIs.title: Block Production
KPIs.description: In order to have a reliable network, a KPI focusing on block production and validator stability is required. Timestamp of each block can be found using the block explorer.
successEvents: The difference between the timestamp of blocks #1065601 and #1267201 must be less than 1229760000 (avg 6.1s/block).
The total Validator+Nominator stake averages between 20% and 30% of total issuance.
KPIs.annihilation: The difference between the timestamp of blocks #1065601 and #1267201 is over 1260000000 (avg 6.25s/block), or the total Validator+Nominator stake averages under 10% of total issuance.

KPIs.title: Managing the Working Groups
KPIs.description: Ensuring a high quality of service is delivered by the Working Groups is a key part of the Council's workload.
successEvents: New budgets are set for each group, taking the 'Recurring Replenishment', platform inflation and the costs for each role into account.
The Council perform spotchecks of working groups performance, and reports the results. More details are available by following the link above to 'Further details and KPI history'.
KPIs.annihilation: Council and/or Jsgenesis spotchecks shows less than 3 SPs up and running at any point during the Term.

KPIs.title: Quality Content Sourcing
KPIs.description: With the new consumer app fast approaching, new quality content is desired. The Council needs to find a way to source more quality content for the platform.
successEvents: The Council delivers a report, outlining how the Joystream can populate the content directory with quality content under sufficiently permissive licenses. Details in Community Repo issue 53.
The Council perform spotchecks of working groups' performance, and reports the results. More details are available by following the link above to 'Further details and KPI history'.

KPIs.title: Managing Community Bounties
KPIs.description: Managing Community Bounties will be a growing part of the Councils workload. Establishing good workflows for this will be iterative and situational.
successEvents: Community Bounty #2 - 'Research and Testing of `polkadot-js extension`', is submitted within the Council Term.
Success events 1-3 of Community Bounty #4 - 'Improve Telegram Bot(s)' (#3 re-issued) are submitted within the Council Term.
Council fulfills their scope of work for opening Community Bounty #5
KPIs.annihilation: Unlike standard `annihilations`, any rewards paid for a Bounty that exceeds what Jsgenesis pays will be deducted from the Council's KPI rewards.

Bounties.title: Update Telegram Bot
Bounties.description: As the old bot is not compatible with the new '@joystream-types', it needs to fixed as soon as possible. Full details can be found here. Note that the bounty has been updated.
successEvents: The existing bot is upgraded to function with the new types - 150
The bot is re-written in typescript - 75
The 'bug' associated with the finalization of Proposals are fixed - 75
conditions: The source code is licensed under GPLv3
As soon as the Council approves the (final) spending proposal, a PR with all the source code is made to the Community Repo.
This includes complete, step by step, instructions for deploying the bot.
Bounties.reviewPeriod: 72 hours from the time the Council submits the Bounty to Jsgenesis.

Bounties.title: Research and Testing of 'polkadot-js extension'
Bounties.description: After the upgrade, we have enabled the polkadot-js extension as part of Pioneer. Full details can be found here.
successEvents: OS and Browser tests performed
Cross device tests performed
Functionality tests performed
conditions: A report with the results is submitted as a PR to the Community Repo.
Bounties.reviewPeriod: 72 hours from the time the Council submits the Bounty to Jsgenesis.

Bounties.description: The bot still needs improvement, see issue 51 in the Community Repo for details.
successEvents: Validators/Block Production - $75
Storage Providers - $100
Proposals - $50

Bounties.title: Joystream Telegram Sticker pack
Bounties.description: Create a Joystream branded sticker pack for Telegram. See issue 52 in the Community Repo for details.
successEvents: Provide details on how to create a sticker pack on Telegram - $100
Produce a sticker pack with at least 10 Joystream branded/related stickers - $300 (max)
Bounties.annihilation: Stickers contain artwork that violates any licenses or copyrights.
conditions: Artwork is made available in the Community Repo
Must be in good taste, and related to the project.
Grading for success event 2 will be highly subjective.
Bounties.reviewPeriod: 7 days from the time the Council submits the Bounty to Jsgenesis.
